meanings.definition: The second crop of grass or hay in a season.
meanings.sent1: After the first harvest, the rowens grew quickly in the field.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was pleased with the quality of the rowens this year.
meanings.sent3: The rowens seemed to wave happily in the breeze, ready for the animals.
meanings.sent4: The rowens stood tall like a green army, waiting to be gathered.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of rowens filled the air, signaling a bountiful season.

meanings.definition: To cut grass or hay for a second crop in a season.
meanings.sent1: The farmer will rowens the field tomorrow to prepare for the next harvest.
meanings.sent2: It is important to rowens at the right time to ensure a good yield.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that he needed a rowensing machine to keep up with the work.
meanings.sent4: She rowensed the grass with precision, knowing it would benefit the soil.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the scythe rowensing through the field was music to the farmer's ears.
